dt: {bc}to break into and steal from (a home, business, etc.) {bc}{sx|burglarize||}

dt.t: One area resident tells {it}Newsweek{/it} her house had been {wi}burgled{/wi} a few years ago while she and her husband were inside.
Clearly, the more often a man … {wi}burgles{/wi}, the more likely he is to get caught.
While the law is a disincentive, the main reason most of us don't kill, punch or {wi}burgle{/wi} is that we think it's wrong and consequently prefer not to.

shortdef: to break into and steal from (a home, business, etc.) : burglarize
